intro: Anemonidium dichotomum, commonly known as the forked anemonidium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowering plants. The plant produces delicate, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are deeply divided, giving the plant a feathery appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
